news_header: A significant Roman historical discovery has been made beneath an office building in London, revealing parts of the ancient city's first basilica, a public building from 2000 years ago.
news_original_title: Beginnings of Roman London discovered in office basement
news_text: The excavation uncovered stone walls and artifacts, shedding light on London's origins and its importance as a capital. The site will be opened to the public after further excavation and will be integrated into new office developments, highlighting the blend of modern architecture and historical preservation.
